text: Any other Sketch 3 user in here? I'm looking for a good Android UI kit. I'm currently using this one: <https://infinum.co/the-capsized-eight/articles/android-lollipop-material-design-ui-kit-for-sketch> but its sizes are not the sizes you would use in mdp and that kit's UI isn't perfect and annoying to use.

attachments.title: Android Lollipop Material Design UI kit for Sketch
attachments.text: When Sketch 3 finally came out and with it the great Teehan & Lax’s iOS 7 UI kit, I was really impressed with two things. How useful kits can be, and how awesome Sketch 3 is. That moved me to make something similar for Android.
attachments.fallback: Android Lollipop Material Design UI kit for Sketch

text: <@U061HDV96>: You can check this <http://www.sketchappsources.com/top-download-free-resources.html> out.

attachments.title: Sketch App Sources - Free graphical resources for Sketch 3 software
attachments.text: Sketch App Sources is a collection of free design resources for the Sketch 3 software by Bohemian Coding. All .sketch files are editable and freely use.
attachments.fallback: Sketch App Sources - Free graphical resources for Sketch 3 software

text: I have checked it out. They're not really what I'm looking for and I'm more like looking for all of the Views that are possible in AS like TimePicker, Checkboxes etc. I can make a grid myself and stuff which is all used in those 'UI Kits'.
Got one: <https://www.google.com/design/spec/resources/sticker-sheets-icons.html>

attachments.title: Sticker sheets & icons - Resources - Google design guidelines
attachments.fallback: Google design guidelines: Sticker sheets & icons - Resources - Google design guidelines

text: I knew they had one, I just lost it somehow
This is a godsent, 24px for 24dp
Nope, I really can't find something to put in here... <https://i.imgur.com/S00CBNM.png>
This is what I've got now, but I'm not really happy with the content. Any ideas? <https://i.imgur.com/AMl9eus.png>
(That blue is because I hovered my mouse over it, so ignore that)
<@U0A7TKB6D|sm> has joined the channel
<@U061HDV96>: can't you just limit the NumberPickers to the opening times?
I might do that, but it's still best to show them too
The TimePicker by default doesn't support editing the min and max on the fly.
Or was it the actual content...?
I think 08:00-12:00 and 14:00-18:00 isn't possible for example
You can use NumberPicker directly
TimePicker is just a subclass

Alright. What do you think about this? <https://i.imgur.com/jDUxLIL.png> I've got the feeling I should use 'pure' white #FFFFFF as a background instead of #FAFAFA which is in the Material Design guidelines.
I'm gonna change those subheaders a bit, they're not aligned properly
I like the slightly darker #fafafa personally better
I've got the feeling that the image I posted is so grey and ugly
Also, that looks better now cause the space is filled
the dividers help too
If I were to follow the guidelines, the suggestions would be this big: <https://i.imgur.com/lcwH3wQ.png>
nah, I think yours is fine
I also still don't like the ordering times part
And I feel the timepicker is a bit empty
you should see our timepicker :confused:
Show me
sec

<@U04TK850N|langerhans> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/langerhans/F0A7UE2BC/pasted_image_at_2015_09_06_06_19_pm.png|Pasted image at 2015-09-06, 6:19 PM> and commented: Date and Time pickers...
there
but we will at least switch out the calendar
Well I can't say I like it, but it looks more complete than mine at least
had to use a custom NumberPicker to make it fade in and out more inactive numbers
It looks good, but I don't see why I would need more.
It's not like you don't know what comes after the number 18
it was just to fill them empty space
This looks way better: <https://i.imgur.com/N1pc297.png>
But I feel like I should perhaps move the TimePicker, but then I'll have empty space to the left
What is main? Labels or content?
the padding of the timepicker is weird
<@U055JANKU>: I agree
top/bottom
Oh that
It's perfectly centered
horizontally, yes
it looks off cause the heading draws attention and you rather compare the distance to that than to the top
but the title is on top which makes it non-centered vertically imo
I assume?
yes
<@U055JANKU>: I adjusted the padding on the timepicker: <https://i.imgur.com/QKM3orD.png>
Better? <https://i.imgur.com/45FFWUB.png>
I’m considering the ‘pickup time’ header to be a relative element and not absolute.
So without header the padding is correct.
With header it is not. Although this one is better.
I'll see how it looks if I add the header as 'it should'
I do think that the header is kind of essential.
Both to be consistent and informative
This? <https://i.imgur.com/FQxod9B.png>
But the subheader makes it look weird
And it still feels kind of empty
I guess I'm just gonna make that Toolbar's functionality already and see from there

><@U061HDV96> Any other Sketch 3 user in here? I'm looking for a good Android UI kit. I'm currently using this one: <https://infinum.co/the-capsized-eight/articles/android-lollipop-material-design-ui-kit-for-sketch> but its sizes are not the sizes you would use in mdp and that kit's UI isn't perfect and annoying to use.

attachments.title: Android Lollipop Material Design UI kit for Sketch
attachments.text: When Sketch 3 finally came out and with it the great Teehan & Lax’s iOS 7 UI kit, I was really impressed with two things. How useful kits can be, and how awesome Sketch 3 is. That moved me to make something similar for Android.

text: <@U0548MM6B>: that's the one I was using that was bad
this is second time someone posted design stuff from my former company
heey
Using the Google one which is way better
one of my friends made that kit :smile:
It's horrible to work with I must say
I want to work in dp
<@U061HDV96>: I see what you mean, but I’m not sure how to solve the empty space.
ah didn't try using it, any specific reason why?
Sketch has no such thing as pixels or points.
It just uses a unit.
So if the template is in 160dpi
And I want that unit to be == 1dp
The Google one is using 1 unit == 1dp, it's such a breeze now
that’s what I meant with the template being 160dpi.
Cause you constantly have to calculate the text size, margin size for guidelines...
<@U055JANKU>: I know
:simple_smile:
I have a design that is 320dpi. So I have to /2 everything.
(Yes I can scale it, but I get new ones now and then)
Well it's vectorised anyway so why not go for 160dp and don't be bothered will all of the stuff
Yep.
<@U0548MM6B>: Is that friend a designer? ^^
yep
Designers..
Only 50% of them understand the concept of dp's
<@U0548MM6B>: his version is also very limited compared to this: <https://i.imgur.com/pHQszTK.png>
ah i know i know :smile: but he's real good, he understands a lot about android and will never ask you to do some crazy stuff
Everything is organised as it should, text styles...
<@U061HDV96>: is that new? in the material guidelines?
It's new, but not very
<@U0548MM6B>: I like that.
Then I just missed it.
Not that I have to design anything.
I do
And I have to work on the backend which leaves me with not very much time for Android
So I implement new features, move to Android, etc.
well it's kinda newer, he did his around the time L was releasing, so you gotta take that into account
It's great he made it, not saying that
Just 'deprecated'
yeah exactly
<@U061HDV96>: you don’t have the option to have someone else do the backend?
anyways, check out his dribble, he has some cool stuff there <https://dribbble.com/ibjelajac>
<@U055JANKU>: we're a 2 person team
We don't have any money to hire other people
I usually work for other people. It saves me time since I do not need to handle client relations.
Well ya who hires an 18yo? I also still want to enjoy my 'student life' :stuck_out_tongue:
All of these companies take advantage of younger people that I don't even want to bother anymore
I'll show them myself what I'm worth
Depends on the company IMO
A lot of people hire me. And I’m being paid well.
‘a lot’, well: ‘enough'
I think the more accurate statement is “shitty companies take advantage of younger people"
If they don’t want to pay my price then they are not my client.
Well I have no degree (yet)
Me neither.
Neither do I
And the only reason I'm at college is because of that shit
I don't even attend
I could stop going to the uni and start working full time if I wanted to.
You are doing college wrong my friend.
But that is the current situation. So I’m still going for that piece of paper.
keep in mind the mentalities are a lot diferent. Here, I wouldn't get a job in that field without a degreee
what is “here”?
de, right?
Germany
ah gotcha
I guess my perspective is from the US
US is really open afaik
or at least would need to show that you are really damn good
but even then, your pay would always be lower than as someone with a degree
<@U04TK850N>: which I'm doing right now :smile:
If you are damn good, any company worth their salt will look at you seriously regardless of schooling.
<@U04TK850N>: that is a fact
<@U04TK850N>: which is also why I'm getting a degree
I do it on the side
I wish I could only go to the finals of every year
I would be able to cram 3 years into 1
What degree are you pursuing <@U061HDV96>?
I don’t want that. :stuck_out_tongue: Living student life :ok_hand:
<@U0A7F5EJF>: Electronics-IT, but I should've gone for industrial engineer IT. I'm probably just gonna do an extra 2 years for masters in industrial engineer IT.
It all depends
ah.. okay.
I literally do NOTHING right now
Electronics-IT? Is that something like Electrical Engineering?
My guess is no
Some teachers I get thought don't even know what they're talking about
<@U055JANKU>: no. First year you just get electronics too
You choose the 3rd semester between electronics (hardware), web (PHP, ugh) or networking (Cisco degree)
Probably gonna get the Cisco degree
Something useful at least
If you don’t think your degree is worth it, why not move into a different degree?
But now I've got to go eat. Resume this later? :smile:
Why waste so much money O_O.
What level do I have to think here?
College?
<@U0A7F5EJF>: college isn't 40k here compared to America
Oh you aren’t in the US
nvm
ha
Dinner now, bye
breakfast for me haha
<@U04TK850N>: you think you wouldn't get a job in IT without a degree in germany?
define "a job in IT" :smile:
developing :simple_smile:
That isn’t IT..?
because my friend got a job at EyeEm as a dropout
That is SD
you can, but your choice of companies will be a lot smaller
and I'm thinking of maybe moving up there if I can find a job
and continue college there if possible
SD as in software development?
yeah
small companies and startups give less fucks about your education I think
what kind of they require? bachelors? or masters?
I have a BSc
thought about Master, but couldn't be arsed to get back to studying :smile:
<@U0A7F5EJF>: why is software not part of IT?
<@U04TK850N>: BSc in? :stuck_out_tongue:
I’m not saying it isn’t, but it is it’s own specific distinction. For example IT and IT:SD mean vastly different things to me.
IT to me means more infrastructure management than IT:SD which is programming
but that is purely anecdotal.
More specific, true
<@U055JANKU>: Business Informatics
so it's part IT, part business
<@U0A7F5EJF> I agree with you, but was just lazy and it was easier to write IT :smile:
I know :wink:
I have a friend who did that.
ah
it's pretty common here for the form of uni I did
i actually thought about transferring to that, since it's much easier than to learn electronics
I went back and forth between studying and working every three months, for three years. got paid all the time :simple_smile: Was neat
I’m currently doing Computer Science.
My current program in the US is work 4 months school 4 months until you graduate
4 months?
Yup. 3 “semesters” in a year
Sorry I should include that you work 4 months and go to school for 4 months and continue that pattern until you graduate
takes about 5 years
Ah. Ok.
Didn’t mean to confuse hah
Work as in internship?
wait what what what
what kind of program is taht?
it’s called “Co-operative learning"
are you native US or imported yourself there?
But it is basically an internship with mandatory pay.
Native US
*immigrated
heh, I kinda like the phrase importing myself.
ooh thought it was one of those work and school in US programs
it's a pretty popular thing here too
usually it's 3 months each tho
I don’t think we have something like that.
And I had to sign that I have to stay for 2 years with the company after I graduate
Especially since my lectures are very theoretical.
Otherwise I would have to pay the fees
Which was about.... 14k€
That’s just plain stupid.
heh
They don't enforce it either cause they know it's a dark-grey-area by law
Surprising.
well, the two years are over in ~4 weeks :simple_smile:
man... we have this study program which I'm on, and if I earn more than 7k euros per year I have to pay taxes, which sucks hard because they're 25%
and we have one where I "work and study" which makes the company pay over half of my salary to the government
I think I’ll just finish what I’m doing now instead of doing weird programs.
Btw, what looks better on your CV: startup founder and developer or paid developer?
startup sounds ‘cool'
Exactly
And I got a chill life
I got no boss on my back
that's cool as long as your startup makes money or someone pays your bills :wink:
Well we don't make money yet, but I don't have to pay for the apartment or anything
Not a whole lot of costs
if you're thinking how startup founder looks on CV, you're already dooming your startup
billionaires don't think about their CV :smile:
Well I was talking about how other companies look at your CV
imho, I'd think better about someone who was a dev then started startup, than someone who had his own startup and now wants to be a dev
mostly because it is more certain that he knows how to work in teams and uses some industry standards
because with startups you can end up like my cto - asking what is a pull request
get yourself into some interesting open source project
working in teams: check
<@U0548MM6B>: I've worked at some places before and have learned it on my own for a couple of years already
i know, but if two random fellas gave me CVs, I'd trust the one who had previous experience more, y'know?
And I'm making my own 'experience' on there with my startup
I'm not looking to get hired :stuck_out_tongue:
just talking hypothetical situations :smile:
You should look at it differently.
You *have* experience. People that never did anything before and just graduated have less things to put on their CV.
<@U04TK850N>: you have a calendar in your app. What do you use to populate it easily?
That in the screenshot is a CalendarView
but we changed it
using this now: <https://github.com/prolificinteractive/material-calendarview>

attachments.title: prolificinteractive/material-calendarview
attachments.text: material-calendarview - A Material design back port of Android's CalendarView

text: I made my own too, but we needed a quick solution
Well I'm just looking how I can change the text in this small calendar easily: <https://i.imgur.com/FEHqmA8.png>
horizontal recyclerview? viewpager?
I personally used a viewpager for my calendar
Yes, but the pain with using a RecyclerView is that I have to compile it every time to see how it looks
And I don't really need the whole Recycling stuff
hm
Perhaps just extending from a LinearLayout and using getChildAt() constantly?
I've got a simple design sample working with LinearLayout.
I could just map them
just relaized you only need today + 6 anyway, so yeah. static layout should be fine
Voila
<@U0A8A8QEN|aalap> has joined the channel
